content: A bill to oppose the provision of assistance to the People's Republic of China by the multilateral development banks.
Jonathan Eric Kaplan, of California, to be Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the United States of America to the Republic of Singapore.
Amy Elizabeth Searight, of the District of Columbia, to be an Assistant Administrator of the United States Agency for International Development, vice Jonathan Nicholas Stivers.
Francisco O. Mora, of Florida, to be Permanent Representative of the United States of America to the Organization of American States, with the rank of Ambassador, vice Carlos Trujillo.

A resolution expressing solidarity with Cuban citizens demonstrating peacefully for fundamental freedoms, condemning the Cuban regime's acts of repression, and calling for the immediate release of arbitrarily detained Cuban citizens.
A bill to improve global health, and for other purposes.
A bill to require a study on the national security implications of the People's Republic of China's efforts to create an official digital currency.
A bill to establish a comprehensive United States Government initiative to build the capacity of young leaders and entrepreneurs in Africa, and for other purposes.

A bill to establish grant programs to improve the health of residents along the United States-Mexico and Unites States-Canada borders and for all hazards preparedness in the border areas, including with respect to bioterrorism, infectious disease, and other emerging biothreats, and for other purposes.
14 nominations, beginning with Wade C. Martin, and ending with Fernando Ospina
41 nominations, beginning with Gabriel J. Allison, and ending with Amanda M. Zeidan
4 nominations, beginning with Susannah Holmes, and ending with Aaron Rodgers
2 nominations, beginning with Russell Anthony Duncan, and ending with Mark Clayton Prescott
2 nominations, beginning with Jeanne Frances Bailey, and ending with Bruce J. Zanin
